search_results.snippet: Falafel (/flfl/; Arabic: , [flfl] ( listen), dialectal: [flfel]) is a deep-fried ball or patty made from ground chickpeas, fava beans, or both. Falafel is a common dish eaten throughout the Middle East. The word Falfil (Arabic: ) is the plural of Filfil (), meaning "pepper".
